column1: Changli (Chinese: 昌黎; pinyin: Chānglí) is a county of northeastern Hebei province
column3: with some Bohai Sea coast. It is under the administration of the Qinhuangdao City
column4: and borders Funing County and Luan County. Both Beijing–Harbin Railway and China National Highway 205 pass through this county.

column1: Changli is one of the largest of China's winemaking districts
column2: with 80 per cent of the county's tillable land used for growing Cabernet Sauvignon grapes. For this reason
column3: Changli is sometimes called China's "Bordeaux region".

column1: The county administers 11 towns and 5 townships.
